subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Bobby Bowden and Florida State are completing a contract that will keep him on the Seminoles’ sideline next season, and maybe longer. Bowden’s lawyer, Russ Campbell of Birmingham, Ala., confirmed that the university and his client had a deal. “We’ve come to a handshake agreement,” Campbell said in a statement. “It hasn’t been finalized yet.”The agreement allows Bowden, 78, to coach as long as he wants, according to the statement.Bowden has 373 career victories, the most among major college coaches, and two more than Penn State’s Joe Paterno, who turns 81 on Dec. 21.
snippet: Bobby Bowden and Florida State are completing a contract that will keep him on the Seminoles’ sideline next season, and maybe longer. Bowden’s lawyer, Russ Campbell of Birmingham, Ala., confirmed that the university and his client had a deal....
